item.title: 世界铂金协会（WPIC）称，供应减少将导致2024年铂金赤字高于预期
item.description: 世界铂金投资理事会（WPIC）周一表示，由于南非和俄罗斯矿山的供应量减少，2024年全球铂金缺口将比之前预期的更大。【原文：The global platinum deficit in 2024 will be deeper than previously expected due to lower supply from mines in South Africa and Russia, the World Platinum Investment Council (WPIC) said on Monday.】

item.title: 欧洲银行的 "金发反弹 "诱使买家和熊市回归
item.description: 在经历了一个出人意料的乐观财报季之后，投资者正竞相重返欧洲银行股，将其股价推向多年高点，但这一反弹也引来了卖空者，他们押注这种乐观情绪不太可能持久。【原文：Investors are racing back into European bank stocks after a surprisingly upbeat earnings season, pushing their shares to multi-year highs, but the bounce has also lured short sellers betting that the optimism is unlikely to last.】

item.title: 永远维持高利率的理由
item.description: 如果金融市场的判断是正确的，那么利率不仅会在今年居高不下，而且可能会永远居高不下。【原文：If financial markets are right, interest rates won't just stay high this year, but possibly forever.】

item.title: 开普勒称欧洲零售对冲基金资产缩水至 8 年低点
item.description: 据周一公布的数据显示，由于利率上升和业绩落后，小投资者纷纷转投他处，欧洲对冲基金行业的散户投资者正在撤出，管理资产缩水至八年来的最低点。【原文：Retail investors are pulling out of Europe's hedge fund industry, with assets under management shrinking to an eight-year low according to data released on Monday, as higher interest rates and lagging performance send smaller investors elsewhere.】

item.title: 早间竞标美国通胀，每个小数点都很重要
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 微软将在法国投资 40 亿欧元
item.description: 技术和软件巨头微软公司副董事长兼总裁布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）告诉《费加罗报》，作为一年一度的 "选择法国 "商业峰会的一部分，微软将在法国投资 40 亿欧元（43 亿美元）。【原文：Technology and software giant Microsoft will invest 4 billion euros ($4.3 billion) in France as part of the annual 'Choose France' business summit, its vice chair and president Brad Smith told Le Figaro paper.】

item.title: 作为 "选择法国 "活动的一部分，法国获得 160 亿美元外国投资
item.description: 法国总统府周一表示，今年的 "选择法国 "活动--旨在吸引外国对法国投资的年度峰会--将促成价值150亿欧元（162亿美元）的外国投资，比去年有所增加。【原文：This year's "Choose France" event - an annual summit aimed at attracting foreign investment to France - will result in 15 billion euros ($16.2 billion) worth of foreign investments, up from last year, said the French presidency on Monday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构就澳新银行发行国债一事展开调查
item.description: 澳新银行集团控股公司周一表示，澳大利亚企业监管机构正在调查该银行在执行澳大利亚金融管理办公室（AOFM）于 2023 年发行 10 年期国债的过程中是否涉嫌违法。【原文：ANZ Group Holdings said on Monday Australia's corporate regulator is investigating the lender for suspected violation of laws in executing the issuance of 10-year treasury bonds by the Australian Office of Financial Management (AOFM) in 2023.】

item.title: 舒默敦促美国联邦贸易委员会为 530 亿美元的雪佛龙-赫斯合并案踩刹车
item.description: 美国参议院多数党领袖查克-舒默（Chuck Schumer）周日敦促联邦贸易委员会对雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp）拟以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司（Hess Corp.【原文：U.S Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer on Sunday urged the Federal Trade Commission to "pump the breaks" on Chevron Corp's proposed $53 billion acquisition of Hess Corp .】

item.title: 亚洲股市为美国通胀测试和中国数据做好准备
item.description: 亚洲股市周一谨慎开盘，本周的通胀数据可能决定美国提前降息的希望成败，而中国的经济活动数据将考验人们对世界第二大经济体持续复苏的乐观程度。【原文：Asian share markets made a cautious start on Monday in a week where inflation figures could make or break hopes for earlier U.S. rate cuts, while Chinese activity data will test optimism about a sustained recovery in the world's No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 汇市平静，美国通胀数据成为本周焦点
item.description: 由于市场参与者在等待美国通胀数据以评估今年降息的前景，主要货币周一持稳，美元兑其他货币盘整。【原文：Major currencies were steady on Monday with the dollar consolidating against peers, as market participants awaited U.S. inflation data to assess the prospects of interest rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 燃料需求疲软，美元走强，石油延续跌势
item.description: 油价周一延续跌势，原因是有迹象表明燃料需求疲软，而且美国联邦储备委员会官员的言论抑制了降息的希望，这可能会减缓全球最大经济体的经济增长并抑制燃料需求。【原文：Oil prices extended declines on Monday amid signs of weak fuel demand and as comments from U.S. Federal Reserve officials dampened hopes of interest rate cuts, which could slow growth and crimp fuel demand in the world's biggest economy.】

item.title: 中国电商巨头面临折扣与利润之间的微妙平衡
item.description: 本周，中国电子商务巨头阿里巴巴和京东的季度财报将受到密切关注，成为世界第二大经济体消费者情绪的晴雨表。【原文：Quarterly earnings reports from Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD.com this week will be closely watched as barometers for the mood of consumers in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 早间竞价：通胀、关税主导市场格局
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 汉莎航空老板对波音公司的问题表示不满
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司首席执行官在接受报纸采访时说，波音公司的飞机交付延迟 "非常令人讨厌"，并使汉莎航空公司损失惨重，但这家美国飞机制造商应该能够解决问题。【原文：Aircraft delivery delays from Boeing are "extremely annoying" and cost Lufthansa lots of money, but the U.S. planemaker should be able to resolve its problems, the German airline's CEO said in a newspaper interview.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英国报业集团就广告屏蔽计划向苹果公司发出警告
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周日报道，英国报业集团警告苹果公司，任何强加所谓 "网页清除器 "工具以屏蔽广告的举动都将危及新闻业的财务可持续性。【原文：British newspaper groups have warned Apple that any move to impose a so-called "web eraser" tool to block advertisements would put the financial sustainability of journalism at risk, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 总统府称亚马逊将宣布在法国投资 12 亿欧元
item.description: 法国总统府周日在法国一年一度的 "选择法国 "活动开始前表示，美国互联网巨头亚马逊将宣布在法国投资 12 亿欧元（13 亿美元）。【原文：U.S. internet giant Amazon will announce a new 1.2 billion euros ($1.3 billion) investment in France, the French presidency said on Sunday ahead of the start of the country's annual "Choose France" event.】

item.title: 辉瑞和阿斯利康宣布在法国新投资近 10 亿美元
item.description: 在本年度 "选择法国 "商业峰会开始之前，领先的医疗保健公司辉瑞和阿斯利康于周日宣布了在法国的新投资，总价值近 10 亿美元。【原文：Leading healthcare companies Pfizer and AstraZeneca announced on Sunday new investments in France worth a total of nearly $1 billion, ahead of the start of this year's annual 'Choose France' business summit.】

item.title: 中国公司赢得更多勘探伊拉克石油和天然气的竞标
item.description: 伊拉克石油部长周日表示，随着中东国家油气勘探许可证发放工作进入第二天，中国公司又赢得了五份勘探伊拉克油气田的竞标。【原文：Chinese companies won five more bids to explore Iraqi oil and gas fields, Iraq's oil minister said on Sunday, as the Middle Eastern country's hydrocarbon exploration licensing round continued into its second day.】

item.title: 法国在重要峰会前为摩根士丹利和其他投资机构赢得职位
item.description: 法国表示，摩根士丹利将在巴黎开设一个新的欧洲办事处，另有两家公司宣布了一项总价值达 7 亿欧元（7.538 亿美元）的投资，法国正准备主办一次重要的年度外国投资峰会。【原文：France said Morgan Stanley would open a new European office in Paris, while two other companies announced a combined investment worth 700 million euros ($753.8 million), as the country prepared to host a key annual foreign investment summit.】

item.title: 德国 Lilium 航空公司和瑞士公司将在法国开设新基地
item.description: 法国财政部长布鲁诺-勒梅尔（Bruno Le Maire）周日表示，德国航空企业 Lilium 和瑞士镍精炼企业 KL1 将在法国建立新的生产基地，总投资额达 7 亿欧元（约合 7.5383 亿美元）。【原文：German aviation firm Lilium and Swiss-based nickel refinery company KL1 will set up new sites in France representing a combined investment of 700 million euros ($753.83 million), French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国工商银行发行 41.5 亿美元 TLAC 债券，拉开 TLAC 债券销售序幕
item.description: 中国工商银行表示，将于 5 月 15 日发行价值 300 亿元人民币（41.5 亿美元）的总损失吸收能力（TLAC）债券，这是中国银行首次发行此类债券。【原文：Industrial and Commercial Bank of China , said it would issue 30 billion yuan ($4.15 billion) worth of total loss-absorbing capacity (TLAC) bonds on May 15, marking the first issuance of such bonds by a Chinese bank.】

item.title: 韩国为芯片产业准备价值超过 70 亿美元的一揽子支持计划
item.description: 韩国财政部长周日表示，韩国正在为价值超过 10 万亿韩元（约合 73.0 亿美元）的芯片投资和研究一揽子支持计划做好准备，此前韩国已将目光投向了打赢一场半导体行业的 "战争"。【原文：South Korea is readying plans for a support package for chip investments and research worth more than 10 trillion won ($7.30 billion), the finance minister said on Sunday, after setting its sights on winning a "war" in the semiconductor industry.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，苹果新泽西州专卖店工人投票反对成立工会
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周六报道，苹果公司位于新泽西州肖特山的专卖店的工人投票反对成立工会。【原文：Workers at Apple's store in Short Hills, New Jersey, have voted against unionizing, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，Arm Holdings 计划在 2025 年推出人工智能芯片
item.description: 据《日经亚洲》周日报道，软银集团旗下的 Arm Holdings 公司计划开发人工智能芯片，力争在 2025 年推出首批产品。【原文：SoftBank Group's Arm Holdings , plans to develop artificial-intelligence chips, seeking to launch the first products in 2025, Nikkei Asia reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 市场：金融家担心私人信贷中的 "杠杆上的杠杆
item.description: 对聚集在洛杉矶参加米尔肯研究所会议的一些金融精英来说，私人市场上的债务狂潮让他们想起了 2008 年金融危机前冒险的狂欢岁月。【原文：To some elite financiers who gathered in Los Angeles for the Milken Institute conference, a debt binge in private markets is reminding them of the go-go days of risk-taking before the 2008 financial crisis.】

item.title: 中国碧桂园在宽限期内偿还在岸票据
item.description: 陷入困境的中国房地产开发商碧桂园周六发表声明称，继上周未偿还债券后，该公司已在五天宽限期到期前偿还了两笔在岸债券。【原文：Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden said in a statement on Saturday it had repaid two onshore bond coupons before the expiry of a five-day grace period, following missed payments last week.】

item.title: 中国公司赢得伊拉克油气田勘探许可证竞标
item.description: 周六，中国公司在一轮碳氢化合物勘探许可招标中中标勘探伊拉克的五个油气田，该轮招标的主要目的是提高天然气产量供国内使用。【原文：Chinese companies won bids to explore five Iraqi oil and gas fields on Saturday in a licensing round for hydrocarbon exploration that was primarily aimed at ramping up gas production for domestic use.】

item.title: 马斯克称卫星压力过大，"星链 "服务质量下降
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司的卫星部门 Starlink 的网站周六显示，该公司的服务正在下降，并补充说该团队正在调查这一问题。【原文：Starlink, the satellite unit of Elon Musk's SpaceX, is experiencing a degraded service, its website showed on Saturday, adding that the team is investigating the issue.】

item.title: 中国居民消费价格连续第三个月上涨，工厂通货紧缩依然存在
item.description: 4 月份，中国居民消费价格连续第三个月上涨，而生产者价格跌幅扩大，这表明尽管经济复苏不稳，但国内需求仍有韧性。【原文：China's consumer prices rose for a third straight month in April while producer prices extended their declines, suggesting resilient domestic demand despite a shaky economic recovery.】
